example[0]: Military service entails frequent changes of domicile.
definition[1]: the country in which a person normally lives, and that is thought of as their permanent home
example[1]: Formerly the domicile of a wife was necessarily the same as that of her husband.
definition[2]: a country in which a person decides to live, although it is not the country in which they were born
example[2]: If he marries a German woman, he has a domicile of choice in Germany.
definition[3]: the country in which a person was born
example[3]: Every person receives at birth a domicile of origin.
